docs.lead_paragraph: DIENST--Richard A.,of Manhattan died on Saturday, October 2. Richard, 71, leaves behind his beloved wife Greer G. Griffith and his three loving children Daniel, Jonathan and Jennifer. He was a devoted father-in-law to Jill Dienst, Victoria Dienst and Jeffrey Kolitch; and an adoring grandfather of Emma, Nicole, Jared, Teddy, Sam, Kate, Ben and Tess. Richard had a long, distinguished career as a trusted counselor and leading attorney for government officials as well as leaders in the fields of insurance, finance and philanthropy. He represented law enforcement unions and also served as a law school professor. Richard passionately argued the constitutional rights of his clients in state and federal courts including the U.S. Supreme Court. For more than 30 years, Richard served as counsel to the NYPD's Detectives Endowment Association, Lieutenants Benevolent Association and Captains Endowment Association. He defended some of the highest ranking members of the NYPD concerning investigations and allegations of official misconduct before the Knapp Commission, the Office of the Special State Prosecutor and the Mollen Commission. He also served as counsel to the Federal Bureau of Investigation Agents Association. Richard will be remembered for his kind and generous heart, his loyalty and his sense of humor. He loved art, music, travel, literature and his dogs. Some of his happiest times were spent cooking for his family and friends. Richard was born and raised in Brooklyn. He was a graduate of Alfred University and Brooklyn Law School. He was previously married to Linda Dienst, the mother of their three children. He is pre-deceased by his sister Norma Bernstein. Richard served on the board of the Respect for Law Alliance. He was an advocate for 'Angel on a Leash' and the 'Delta Society' groups - which help therapy dogs bring joy to children and adults in health care facilities. Visitation at 4pm and Celebration of His Life at 5:30pm, Wednesday, October 6 at Frank E. Campbell Funeral Chapel, 1076 Madison Ave., New York, NY. Donations in lieu of flowers can go to: Angel On A Leash, 630 9th Ave., New York, NY 10036 or Delta Society, 875 124th Ave., Bellevue, WA 98005. Richard will be greatly missed by all who had the privilege of knowing him.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a season when many Democrats are running away from the president's health care bill - a plan some Republicans having been attacking as "Obama care" - Senator Russ Feingold of Wisconsin just cut a campaign ad aligning himself with that very topic.

headline.main: Feingold Ad Says He Fought Insurers

docs.abstract: Unlike many Democrats, the Wisconsin senator wants people to know about his vote to overhaul the health-care system.
